intro: Pentaschistis gracilis, commonly known as the slender false heath, is a small shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
